snippet: Last week, the lame duck Charles J. Hynes demoted two prosecutors who wanted to drop charges against a Hasidic whistle-blower and fired one who had complained about the office’s transparency.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column scores aggressive and graceless actions of Brooklyn District Attorney Charles J Hynes in his last weeks in office following defeat in November elections; notes that lame duck Hynes has demoted two prosecutors who had wanted to drop charges against Hasidic whistle-blower Sam Kellner, and fired a third prosecutor who had complained about lack of transparency in DA's office.
lead_paragraph: Last week, the lame duck Charles J. Hynes demoted two prosecutors who wanted to drop charges against a Hasidic whistle-blower and fired one who had complained about the office’s transparency.

headline.main: After Ugly Campaign, Finding Little Grace in Brooklyn District Attorney’s Exit
headline.print_headline: After Ugly Campaign, Finding Little Grace in Brooklyn District Attorney’s Exit
